implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. This is used to display the list of tasks to the user.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a GET request is made to /tasks:
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return the list of Task objects

implementation.name: get_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Fetches all tasks from the persistent storage. Used by the read_tasks endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
If the tasks.json file does not exist:
    Return an empty list
Open tasks.json for reading
Try to load the JSON data
    For each item in data:
        Convert to Task object
    Return list of Task objects
If JSON is invalid:
    Return empty list

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives task data from the user and creates a new task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with TaskCreate data:
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created Task object

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Creates a new Task object, assigns a unique ID, and saves it to persistent storage.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call get_tasks() to get current tasks
Create a new Task object with a unique id and provided fields
Append the new Task to the list
Call save_tasks(tasks) to persist
Return the new Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated task data and updates the task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with TaskCreate data:
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If no task is found:
        Raise 404 error
    Return the updated Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing task with new data and saves changes.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call get_tasks() to get current tasks
For each task in tasks:
    If task.id matches task_id:
        Create updated Task with new data
        Replace the old task
        Call save_tasks(tasks)
        Return updated Task
If not found, return None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task. Removes the task with the given ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not found:
        Raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a task from persistent storage by ID.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Call get_tasks() to get current tasks
Filter out the task with the given id
If a task was removed:
    Call save_tasks(tasks)
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

implementation.name: Task, TaskCreate, TaskBase
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the schema for tasks, including fields for title, description, priority, due_date, category, and completed status. Used for validation and serialization.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define Priority enum: Low, Medium, High
Define Category enum: Work, Personal, Study
Define TaskBase model with:
    title (str)
    description (Optional[str])
    priority (Priority, default Medium)
    category (Optional[Category])
    due_date (Optional[date])
    completed (bool, default False)
Define TaskCreate inheriting TaskBase
Define Task inheriting TaskBase with id (str)

missing_implementations: A new task must include a tag (the model uses 'category', but not 'tag'; if 'tag' is a separate field, it is missing).
